item.title: Kim add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "The day has been so full of fret and care, and our hearts have been so full of evil and of bitter thoughts, and the world has seemed so hard and wrong to us. Then Night, like some great loving mother, gently lays her hand upon our fevered head, and turns our little tear-stained faces up to hers, and smiles; and though she does not speak, we know what she would say, and lay our hot flushed cheek against her bosom, and the pain is gone." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Kim add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "We are each of an unsocial, taciturn disposition, unwilling to speak, unless we expect to say something that will amaze the whole room, and be handed down to posterity with all the eclat of a proverb." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kim add a quote by Wally Lamb
item.description: "This was what could happen to you: you could end up this far from where you thought you were going." -- Wally Lamb

item.title: Kim add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "Petting, scratching, and cuddling a dog could be as soothing to the mind and heart as deep meditation and almost as good for the soul as prayer." -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Kim add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: "These days, Clarissa believes, you measure people first by their kindness and their capacity for devotion. You get tired, sometimes, of wit and intellect; everybody's little display of genius." -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Kim add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I certainly have not the talent which some people possess," said Darcy, "of conversing easily with those I have never seen before. I cannot catch their tone of conversation, or appear interested in their concerns, as I often see done." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kim add a quote by Wally Lamb
item.description: "I am not a smart man, particularly, but one day, at long last, I stumbled from the dark woods of my own, and my family's, and my country's past, holding in my hands these truths: that love grows from the rich loam of forgiveness; that mongrels make good dogs; that the evidence of God exists in the roundness of things. This much, at least, I've figured out. I know this much is true." -- Wally Lamb

item.title: Kim add a quote by Mary Doria Russell
item.description: "I do what I do without hope of reward or fear of punishment. I do not require Heaven or Hell to bribe or scare me into acting decently." -- Mary Doria Russell

item.title: Kim add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "It's no good pretending that any relationship has a future if your record collections disagree violently or if your favorite films wouldn't even speak to each other if they met at a party." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Kim add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "We all spend so much time not saying what we want, because we know we can't have it. And because it sounds ungracious, or ungrateful, or disloyal, or childish, or banal. Or because we're so desperate to pretend that things are OK, really, that confessing to ourselves they're not looks like a bad move. Go on, say what you want. ... Whatever it is, say it to yourself. The truth will set you free. Either that or it'll get you a punch in the nose. Surviving in whatever life you're living means lying, and lying corrodes the soul, so take a break from the lies for just one minute." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Kim add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "When we hope, we usually hope for the wrong thing." -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Kim add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "I love the relationship that anyone has with music ... because there's something in us that is beyond the reach of words, something that eludes and defies our best attempts to spit it out. ... It's the best part of us probably ..." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Kim add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "Happiness is a warm puppy." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Kim add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "You think those dogs will not be in heaven! I tell you they will be there long before any of us." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Kim add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Kim add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kim add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Dogs are our link to paradise. They don't know evil or jealousy or discontent. To sit with a dog on a hillside on a glorious afternoon is to be back in Eden, where doing nothing was not boring--it was peace." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Kim add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
Kim add a quote by Terry Goodkind
item.description: "Charity, if you have the means, is a personal choice, but charity which is expected or compelled is simply a polite word for slavery." -- Terry Goodkind

item.title: Kim add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Kim add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There are few people whom I really love, and still fewer of whom I think well. The more I see of the world, the more am I dissatisfied with it; and every day confirms my belief of the inconsistency of all human characters, and of the little dependence that can be placed on the appearance of merit or sense." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kim add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "People worry about kids playing with guns, and teenagers watching violent videos; we are scared that some sort of culture of violence will take them over. Nobody worries about kids listening to thousands - literally thousands - of songs about broken hearts and rejection and pain and misery and loss." -- Nick Hornby
